set1.question-item-text: In uniform circular motion, the centripetal force and centripetal acceleration are ---------- direction.
Cohesion and adhesion are two types of ---------- forces.
Heat, light and ---------- are the most common forms of energy.
A black object is a good absorber and a good radiator whose ---------- is close to one.
The ---------- is the unit used for measuring sound intensity.
The angular position of a point of a periodic wave is known as the ----------.
The capacitors are connected in ---------- each capacitor has the same charge.
In the SI system, the unit of capacitance is ----------.
Batteries and electric generators are called sources of ---------- force.
An electric light bulb is made of a glass bulb consisting a ---------- filament.
In any electrical appliance the ---------- wire is always connected to the metal case.
A ---------- is a semiconductor device that converts light into electrical current.
The basic operations in Boolean algebra are ----------, OR, and NOT.
---------- of food has potential to produce safe foods with long shelf life.

set2.question-item-text: A ---------- body is a body that does not deform or change shape.
---------- and adhesion are two types of intermolecular forces.
Solar cells convert light energy into ---------- energy.
Thermal equilibrium occurs when the systems are at the same ----------.
The speed of sound is ---------- in solids than liquids and gases.
Human eye is more sensitive to ---------- light compared to other colors.
Wavefront is always perpendicular to the direction of ----------.
The SI unit of capacitance is ----------.
If a 1200 W electric ion is used for 50 min, the electricity meter reading increases by ---------- unit.
When a current flows through the nichrome coil of an electric stove, it produces ---------- energy.
In the lighting circuit, the light bulbs are arranged in ---------- across the mains line.
The magnitude of induced emf in a wire loop is directly proportional to the rate of change of ---------- through that loop.
The photodiode is a semiconductor device that converts ---------- into electrical current.
---------- is the process of recovering audio signal from modulated wave.
An alpha particle consists of two protons and ---------- neutrons.

set4.question-item-text: ---------- force in a circular motion is not a real force; it acts really away from the centre of the circle.
----------, air, steam, and foam are generally considered to be compressible.
The typical output of a solar cell is ---------- energy.
Heat convection is one of the primary ---------- of heat transfer.
The SI unit of sound intensity is the ---------- per square metre.
An aperture is a circular opening through which the ---------- passes.
The angular position of a periodic wave is known as the ---------- angle.
---------- is required to control the current and facilitate gradual charging or discharging in a capacitor circuit.
In the series connection of the capacitors, each capacitor has the same ----------.
Electrical energy is energy associated with the flow of charge through any part of ----------.
The potential difference is the amount of ---------- required to move a unit charge from one end to another end of a circuit element.
The current from the outlet of a phone charger is ---------- current.
An ----------, one of the most widely used in optoelectronics, is a semiconductor light source that emits light when current flows through it.
An ---------- gate is a digital logic gate that outputs a high (1) signal only when all its inputs are high(1).
In gamma decay, the atomic number and mass number and mass number of the ---------- and daughter nuclei remain unchanged.
